metadata.title: CVE-2020-20739 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
im_vips2dz in /libvips/libvips/deprecated/im_vips2dz.c in libvips before8.8.2 has an uninitialized variable which may cause the leakage of remoteserver path or stack address.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-20739` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-vips-8.0 - 8.9.1-2
libvips-tools - 8.9.1-2
libvips42 - 8.9.1-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: vips package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '8.9.1-2').
